name: Mac OS X Dock Extra
summary: A DOCK file is a Dock Extra used in certain versions of Mac OS X, a previous Mac operating system . It contains a small program, sometimes referred to as a "docklet," that allows Mac OS X users to monitor and adjust settings on their PCs, such as display preferences or Wi-Fi settings. DOCK files have since been superseded by Menu Extras ( .MENU files).

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
